subhead: For many people of color, fleeing a police stop has become a reflex. Sociologists say this risky behavior stems from the rise in incidents of police violence.

title: Lithuania closes its border with Belarus
subhead: The Baltic state condemned a violation of its airspace after dozens of helium-filled balloons launched from Belarus forced Vilnius Airport to close four times in recent days.

title: Trump and Takaichi swap praise for 'new golden age of ties' between Japan and the US
subhead: Sanae Takaichi, Japan's first female prime minister, lavished praise on Donald Trump, adding that she will nominate him for a Nobel Peace Prize. Trump said he would like to 'realize a new golden age of the US-Japan alliance.'

title: In Paris, three exhibitions celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: Southern Syria's Sweida sees Druze and Bedouin communities locked in hatred
subhead: Several hundred members of both communities were taken prisoner during the clashes that erupted between them in July. Three months later, the majority are still captives, further fueling the conflict.

title: On social media, women share their abortion stories to break the silence
subhead: In the face of misinformation and guilt-inducing rhetoric online, some users have chosen to speak openly about their abortions on these platforms. While sometimes it is simply a desire to share their personal experiences, more often, it remains a consciously political act.

title: Orson Welles, the magician of all media at the Cinémathèque française
subhead: Forty years after the titan's death and 110 years after his birth, a major exhibition and retrospective offer a portrait of this brilliant jack-of-all-trades who endlessly blurred the lines between truth and fiction.
